text: Patient: Uh hum. Doctor: The reason is so you know everybody wants to be helpful and you know give you all kinds of natural products and things like mistletoe or kabuki mushrooms or whatever. The problem is that a lot of them are antioxidants. Patient: Okay. Doctor: So they’re really good stuff, except when you’re trying to kill bad things, and then they interfere because one of the things we’re trying to do in chemo is make reactive oxygen species which kill, make the DNA not work and breaks up and then the cells break up. If you give a medicine like mistletoe to interfere with the creation of those uh you know, what’s basically hydrogen peroxide that kills ah the cells, then you’re interfering with chemotherapy and radiation therapies. Family Member: The effectiveness of the chemo Patient: So that would be something . Uh nutrition – Then I’m scheduled to speak with someone from a company out of Colorado called Doctor: Hmmmm Patient: Should I hold off on that during the period of treatment as well? Doctor: So, so, yes. Uhm um they have some things that interfere with what we do. Patient: Okay. Doctor: And so I’m you know all holistic approaches for all these things. I can tell you back in the day I wrote books about this stuff. Patient: Okay.

text: Patient: Okay. Doctor: Um, a biologic, so not a chemo. Patient: Yeah. Doctor: Um many, many arms of this trial. It’s like the octopus study. Patient: Yeah. Doctor: Where there’s a lot. But you’re basically taking a pill. There is a pathway that’s always screwed up with prostate cancer. This sort of tackles that pathway. Patient: Okay. Doctor: Not through the antigen receptor, which is all those IT doesn’t expand these but a completely different way to shut down the cell. Patient: Okay. Doctor: So, but you have to figure out where you are in that trial. So the first thing she needs to do is be able to test your specimens for this particular marker. Patient: Okay. Doctor: So that’s the first thing. The second thing is that if we do get you on, probably the top three side effects would be tiredness.

Doctor-Patient-Conversation-Analysis-pos.text: Thank you for your valuable contributions to our study! Our goal is to understand how doctors can communicate better with patients by looking at different perceptions of the doctors’ qualities. Understanding your personal experiences with the medical system will help us to contextualize your responses. We invite you to share insights by answering the following questions. Your answers to these questions are strictly confidential and anonymous.
Doctor-Patient-Conversation-Analysis-pos.displayed_text: Thank you for your valuable contributions to our study! Your answers to these questions are strictly confidential and anonymous.
